posts.post_content:
Combo with [mindslaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mindslaver) and [soul foundry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=soul foundry). Imprint the sky swallower under the soul foundtry, play the mindslaver. Hand over the turn with atleast 4 mana open and during his turn activate the mindslaver. In your own turn following that, activate soul foundry, handing over every permanent *including* the soul foundry with the sky swallower imprinted.   
  
Hand over the turn again and laugh maniacally as you activate 'his' soul foundry again to take control over everything, including all the stuff you gave him, leaving behind an 8/8 flyer (that you incidentally ALSO have!).  
  
Add artifact recurrence for the mind slaver ([academy ruins](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=academy ruins) [buried ruin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=buried ruin) are my favorites, but non-land versions also work ofcourse), some tutoring ([tinker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=tinker) [treasure mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=treasure mage) for example) and any kind of mana accelerate (remember, the entire combo is colorless, you dont actually pay blue to play the s... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: N3rf (8/26/2011 8:07:18 AM)

posts.post_content:
Use a lot of land that sacrifice themselves (Depletion Land) or give themselves to your opponent (Rainbow Vale) along with 4 Delusions of Mediocrity and 4 Illusions of Grandeur. Bronze Bombshells are pretty good for this too. And since the deck is mono-blue, you can run plenty of counter magic. Force of Will, Shoal, Thwart and Daze are a must since you won't have much land after this guy enters play. He works pretty well with Aether Vial too. Sure your giving your opponent a Vial with 5 counters on it (6 counters if your clever and wait for the VIal's upkeep trigger to hit the stack first so your opponent can't play Siege-Gang Commander). Barely anyone plays 6 drops in Legacy or Vintage...  
  
He's also good with cards like Lich and Immortal Coil.

posts.post_content: Has no one here seen [Brooding Saurian](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brooding Saurian)? With all of the multicolored mana generators out lately, being able to play both, one after the other (Saurian turn 4, this turn 5) shouldn't be too tough, and with Saurian out when this guy comes down, all you really lose are tokens.

posts.post_content:
In addition to throwing your [Bronze Bombshells](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bronze Bombshells ) at a player, you can also use [Brand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brand) to get everyone back. [Brooding Saurian](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brooding Saurian ) works well with it, too.
  
   
I'm sure you could find a way to use [Reins of Power](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reins of Power ) with Sky Swallower, but currently, I like [Brand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brand) better.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: @leomistico: I'm 99% sure that wont work... See for you to use the Bazzar Trader, it has to already be on the battlefield. posts.post_content:
An interesting card, usually not worth it, unless you plan around it... but you would need more combos than just this for it to be marginally effective. More of a thought experiment than an actually played card.  
  
Re: AvatarofBro  
Look at the flavor text for [Simic Sky Swallower](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Simic Sky Swallower); it was intentional that they are in the same block. Simic Sky Swallower was bred from the Sky Swallower.  
  
Re: Nashcoil  
[Confusion in the Ranks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Confusion in the Ranks) doesn't combo with this card. You still control the enters the battlefield trigger. [Endless Whispers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Endless Whispers) does, [Jhoira of the Ghitu](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jhoira of the Ghitu) plus board removal or [Brand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brand) can negate the drawback in different ways.
posts.html:
An interesting card, usually not worth it, unless you plan around it... but you would need more combos than just this for it to be marginally effective. More of a thought experiment than an actually played card.

Re: AvatarofBro
Look at the flavor text for Simic Sky Swallower; it was intentional that they are in the same block. Simic Sky Swallower was bred from the Sky Swallower.

Re: Nashcoil
Confusion in the Ranks doesn't combo with this card. You still control the enters the battlefield trigger. Endless Whispers does, Jhoira of the Ghitu plus board removal or Brand can negate the drawback in different ways.
